title: Is it just me or are Mega Orbs a letdown?
body:
Don't get me wrong, maybe for that person looking for that random legacy skin they could be good...
but I totally just got a Heartseeker Ashe skin I own that I've also had 3 times over from normal chest and key combos.

I guess that's 150 tickets down the drain.

replies.body: Every orb was a let down

They really dropped the _orb_ on this one.

######_...Okay, I'll see myself out now._

I opened a Mega Orb and got 1 mega orb and 4 gemstones.

It's pretty much something that people who are familiar with Trading Card Games get used to.

You buy in bulk so that you aren't so hurt from them padding their loot.
Wow, nice.
Riot's never ahead of the curve on these things. Their loot system is no exception; tons and tons of work for almost no payout.
Yeah, I'm not saying I need any of the bonus prizes for it to be good. I'm just saying maybe make it a legacy skin I don't have?
Any chance you don't get what you want increases the chance you will have to buy it instead. I still have 15 keys I can't use and my last 5 chests were like all champ shards when I own them all.
24 boxes, gimme some of them, I'll trade you

ive got enough keys for all of them 

if only we could split the loot :P
Welcome to Loot Box systems. Riot is no exception but they're also not the only one. It simply preys upon those who gamble.
Kids can legally gamble because they purchased funny money first. Gotta love loopholes to prey on the young.

At least League is a free to play game, and doesn't make you pay premium to get into the casino to begin with.

Looking at you Overwatch.

And Shadow of War.

And a lot of other titles released in recent history.

...**WHY IS THIS A THING?**

It's why I started playing this game 5 years ago. I've introduced many friends to the game over time who have also introduced others. While I never gave any money to Riot, most of my friends did. The F2P model is really the best way to go. It gets the game big. I'd play Overwatch if it was free. Some of my friends bought it but they stopped playing because not enough friends play it. You have to get big to get bigger.

I'd say Duel Links' Set boxes is one of the best loot system of recent memory.
LD drop rates... that's another story, but still significantly better.

I agree with this. The chance to get the new Hec skin and possibly 2 gemstones is awesome and all, but legacy skins are mostly legacy for a reason. They were old and not up to snuff with the current standards.  Most of the legacy skins you get were purchasable for 520. This means that, if you don't want it or already have it, the skin is worth significantly less Orange dust than the average.

the problem with mega orb is that it gives a legacy skin, and while sure its nice to have something that is no longer available, the mayority of the legacy skins are nothing compare to new skins, so unless you get one of the extra prizes when opening one, is going to be a let down

Skin shard hunting is also unrewarding since you can get shards for skins you already own.
